gurmukhi: sB smuMdR ky nwm lY AMq Sbd sq dyhu ]pun Dr Sbd aucwrIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]95]
transliteration: Sabh Saoundra Ke Naam Lai Ant Shabad Sat Deh(u)|| Poun Dhar Shabad Oucdareeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||95||
translation: Saying all the names of “Samudra” (Ocean), adding the word “Shatdeh” at the end and afterwards uttering the word “Dhar”, all the names of Baan come forward.95.

gurmukhi: jlpiq jl lY ndI piq kih sq pd ko dyhu ]puin Dr Sbd bKwnIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]96]
transliteration: Jal-pat(i) Jal Lai Nadipat(i) Kah(i) Sat Pad Ko Deh(u)|| Poun(i) Dhar Shabad Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||96
translation: After saying the word “Samudra” (Ocean), adding the word “Shatdeh” and afterwards saying the word “Dhar”, all the names of Baan can be comprehended.96.

gurmukhi: nIrwlY srqwiD piq kih sq pd ko dyhu ]puin Dr Sbd bKwnIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]97]
transliteration: Neeraalai Sartaadh(i) Pat(i) Kah(i) Sat Pad Ko Deh(u)|| Poun(i) Dhar Shabad Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||97||
translation: After uttering the words “Neeralya and Saritadhpati”, then adding the word “Shat” and afterwards saying “Dhar”, the names of Baan are pronounced.97.

gurmukhi: sBY JKn ky nwm lY ibrIAw kih lY eyk ]sqDr khu sB nwm sr inksq jwih Anyk ]98]
transliteration: Sabhai Jhakhanndke Naam Lai Bireeaa Kah(i) Lai Ek|| Satdhar Kahu Sabh Naam Sar Niksat Jaahe Anek||98||
translation: Naming once all the disputes and then saying the word “Shatdhar”, many names of Baan get evolved.98.

gurmukhi: sB jl jIvin nwm lY AwsRY bhuir bKwn ]sqDr bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn sB jwn ]99]
transliteration: Sabh Jal Jeevan(i) Naam Lai Aasrai Bahur(i) Bakhaan|| Satdhar Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Sabh Jaan||99||
translation: Naming the fish remaining alive in water, then adding the word “Aashraya” with them and then saying the word “Shatdhar”, the names of Baan continue to be described.99.

gurmukhi: DrI ngn ky nwm kih Drsq puin pd dyhu ]puin Dr Sbd bKwnIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]100]
transliteration: Dharinagad Ke Naam Kah(i) Dharsat Poun(i) Pad Deh(u)|| Poun(i) Dhar Shabad Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||100||
translation: Naming the Nagas (serpents) found on the earth, and adding the word “Dharshat” and then saying the word “Dhar”, the names of Baan are known.100.

gurmukhi: bwsv kih Air aucrIAY Dr sqDr puin BwKu ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky jwn jIA mY rwKu ]101]
transliteration: Baasav Kah(i) Ar(i) Ouchreeai Dhar Satdhar Poun(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Jaan Jeea Mai Raakh(u)||101||
translation: Uttering the word “Ari” after the word “Indra” and then adding the word " Shatdhar",all the names of Baan are comprehended in mind. 101.

gurmukhi: puhp DnK ky nwm kih AwXuD bhur aucwr ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky inksq clY Apwr ]102]
transliteration: Puhap Dhanakh Ke Naam Kah(i) Aayudh Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Niksat Chalai Apaar||102||
translation: Speaking the names of Pushpdhanva and Kaamdev and then uttering the word “Aayudh”, the names of Baan continue to be evolved.102.

gurmukhi: skl mIn ky nwm kih kyquvwXuD kih AMq ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky inksq jwih AnMq ]103]
transliteration: Sakal Meen Ke Naam Kah(i) Ketwaayudh Ka(i) Ant|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Niksat Jaahe Anant||103||
translation: Uttering all the names of fish and adding the word “Ketwayudh” at the enc, the innumerable names of Baan continue to be evolved.103.

gurmukhi: puhp Awid kih DnuK kih Dr AwXu`Dih bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky inksq jwq ApRmwn ]104]
transliteration: Puhap Aadh Kah(i) Dhanoukh Kah(i) Dhar Aayuddhah(i) Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Niksat Jaat Apramaan||104||
translation: If the weapons are described after uttering the word "Pushp" and then adding the word "Dhanush", then ahe nmaes of Baan continue to be evolved.104.

gurmukhi: Awid BRmr kih pnc kih DrDr Sbd bKwn ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky jwnhu gunn inDwn ]105]
transliteration: Aadh Bhramar Kah(i) Panch Kah(i) Dhardhar Shabad Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Jaanoh Gounan Nidhaan||105||
translation: Saying the word “Bhramar” in the beginning, then adding the word “Panch” and then saying the word “Dhardhar”, all the names of Baan are known by the wise people.105.

gurmukhi: sB Blkn ky nwm kih Awid AMq Dr dyhu ]nwm skl sRI bwn ky cIn cqur icq lyhu ]106]
transliteration: Sabh Bhalkan Ke Naam Kah(i) Aadh Ant Dhar Deh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Cheen Chatur Chit Leh(u)||106||
translation: Uttering the names of all the small lances and adding the word “Dhar” at the end, the wise people recognize in their mind the names of Baan.106.

gurmukhi: ijh Dr piRQm bKwn iqh suq bhur bKwnIAY ]sr ky nwm pRmwn cqur icq mY jwnIho ]107]
transliteration: Jih Dhar Pritham Bakhaan Tih Sout Bahur Bakhaaneeai|| Sar Ke Naam Pramaan Chatur Chit Mai Jaaneeho||107||
translation: Whosoever described the earth in the beginning, many names of Baan continue to be evolved, when her sons are brought under description.107.
